text.quote: 1: Clause 2, page 2, line 7, at end insert—

“( ) Regulations may provide for circumstances in which a person may opt to have a year treated as a qualifying year if by aggregating income from two or more jobs, that person’s earnings are equal to or greater than the lower earnings level for that year.”

3: After Clause 2, insert the following new Clause—
“Pension statement
(1) The Secretary of State may by regulation introduce arrangements for the periodic notification to individuals of their entitlement to request a pension statement.
(2) Such regulations shall not require the provision of such notification before a person has reached the age of 45 nor, subject to subsection (3) below, more frequently than once every five years.
(3) Such regulations shall require notification of entitlement to receive a pension statement in the penultimate year before a person reaches state pension age.”

“Work-based schemes: requirements for disclosure of charges and other information

text.quote: 28: After Clause 43, insert the following new Clause—
“Work-based schemes: requirements for disclosure of charges and other information (No. 2)

(1) The Secretary of State shall by regulations make provision to require disclosure at least annually of the management and transaction charges incurred by the administration and management of each investment portfolio managed by or on behalf of a work-based scheme.
(2) Regulations made under this section may, inter alia, provide for the disclosure of—
text.IndentOne: (a) fees and performance fees paid to investment managers,
(b) commissions and bid-offer spreads paid to brokers,
(c) bid-offer spreads paid to foreign exchange counterparties,
(d) fees, revenue splits and bid-offer spreads paid to custodian banks,
(e) fees paid to in-house or third party scheme administrators,
(f) fees paid to professional advisors (e.g. actuaries, legal advisers, auditors, investment consultants etc.),
(g) initial charges, bid-offer spreads, exit charges, other fees and rebates charged on investments in pooled funds, and
(h) any other management and transaction charges that the Secretary of State from time to time considers appropriate.”
